subject: Learning
title: Brain Training Games: Do They Work?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Brain Training Games: Do They Work?.

hook.text: An app promises that 15 minutes of brain games a day will make you sharper. Millions paid up.

buildup.text: Brain training games claim to improve memory, attention, and processing speed through practice.

discovery.text: Research shows you get better at the specific gameâ€”but the improvement doesn't transfer to real life.

twist.text: Lumosity was fined $2 million by the FTC for deceptive advertising about cognitive benefits.

climax.text: The most effective brain training? Regular exercise, sleep, and learning genuinely new skills.

punchline.text: Brain games train you to play brain games. That's it.

quiz.question: What do studies say about brain training games?
options: Improvement in the game doesn't transfer to real-life cognitive tasks
They permanently boost IQ by 15 points
They are more effective than exercise for brain health
